Thank you Ken, it is really fun thing to play with :) What about 
using LIs=
 (leaky integrators) to produce smoother movements and 
stuff? I think this=
 could make it more realistic.. If I have the 
time, I can do (implement) t=
his myself, but I think it is a good 
idea, especially for those ragdolls..=
 :) 


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@...> wrote:=

>
> We've released executables and source code for Dance Evolution, 
which=
 
> allows you to interactively evolve dancers to any MIDI song:
> 
> http:=
//eplex.cs.ucf.edu/dance_evolution/
> 
> The dancers are controlled by ANNs=
 that evolve and complexify 
through 
> NEAT.
> 
> We've heard there might =
be some installation problems on some 
Windows 
> computers, although it se=
ems to work on most.  Please let me know 
if 
> you have problems (or you c=
an email the help address in the README).
> 
> By releasing the source I ho=
pe people will not only enjoy evolving 
> cool dance moves (which you can s=
hare as a genome file) but also 
feel 
> free to hack the system and change=
 how it works.
> 
> ken
>
